reviewText: NEW LINE CINEMA's colorful history includes releasing "Reefer Madness" in the late '60s, as well as several of John Waters' films. Their first big commercial success was the "Nightmare on Elm Street" series. Since then, NEW LINE has distributed "Lord of the Rings," "Austin Powers" and "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles." Ted Turner purchased the company in 1994. It became a WARNER BROS. subsidiary in early 2008.This "NEW LINE ROMANTIC COMEDY 4 Pack" is a mixture of good to middling films, with "Don Juan DeMarco" being the best of the lot.Also recommended isROMANTIC COMEDY: 4 FILM FAVORITES(another WARNER's product), which offers a similar mix of mid '90s movies.SYNOPSES--THE BACHELOR--  In order to inherit a fortune, a marriage-phobic man must take a bride before his 30th birthday. Remake of a stageplay first brought to the screen in 1925 ("Seven Chances," starring Buster Keaton).BED OF ROSES--  Love-at-first-sight brings a shy florist out of his shell. He romances a career girl and sweeps her off her feet.DON JUAN DEMARCO--  A young man attempts suicide while garbed in a swashbuckler costume and is placed under a psychiatrist's care for 10 days of intense therapy. During these sessions, the patient insists he is the famous lover, Don Juan and reveals a detailed past to support his contention.LAWS OF ATTRACTION--  Two competing NYC divorce lawyers clash and later date, fall in love and marry while visiting Ireland.Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website.(4.8) The Bachelor (1999) - Chris O'Donnell/Renée Zellweger/Ed Asner/Hal Holbrook/Peter Ustinov/Mariah Carey/Brooke Shields(5.5) Bed of Roses (1996) - Christian Slater/Mary Stuart Masterson/Pamela Adlon/Josh Brolin(6.5) Don Juan DeMarco (1995) - Marlon Brando/Johnny Depp/Faye Dunaway/Bob Dishy/Rachel Ticotin/Selena(5.7) Laws of Attraction (Ireland/UK/Germany-2004) - Pierce Brosnan/Julianne Moore/Michael Sheen/Nora Dunn/Sara Gilbert
summary: Depp, Slater, Brosnan and O'Donnell (a romantic 4-some)

reviewText: All 4 of the movies on this DVD are not great movies, but they are good enough if you are looking to watch a light-hearted love story.  I would recommend this to you if you like "candy" movies.
summary: If you like romantic films, this DVD is for you.

reviewText: Okay, I buy a lot of DVD movies off the bargain rack at a nearby Ross Store and then review them for Amazon. Lately, I've been getting them from the  five-dollar rack at Wall-Mart. It's a fun thing to do, a bit of a hobby, and I've seen some really good films in this way. Some of their biggest bargains are these multi-pack things that have two, three or four movies, such as this particular one featuring four romantic comedies. Well, on a per-movie basis ($1.25 per movie), they're an ultra-bargain, if they're any good. Ah, there's the catch! If they're any good. Well, this packet of Romantic Comedies is simply awful. Look, I reviewed them all as individual movies and none rated any higher than three stars and I was embarrassed to give a couple two stars because they really deserved only one. Are you saving money buying this packet? Well, it's your dime and you can do what you like. Are you getting a good selection of movies? Well, taste in movies is very subjective. If, on the other hand, you're looking for a bargain way of numbing the mind, then this packet is an exceptional deal.Gary Peterson
Title: N/A

reviewText: Other than Don Juan Demarco this is a group of childishly written romances.  Reminds me of those dime store romance books.  So sad to see such good actors in such cliche and predictable love situation comedies.  Think "Hallmark" channel.

reviewText: I'm not a huge chick flick lover, but my Mother is and she loved this gift. This is a great addition to your library or gift for anyone who swoons over fun, romantic comedies. The true gems here are definitely the tear inducing brilliant transfers of Untamed Heart and Don Juan. Enjoy!
